  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Rewards​(int width, int length)
    Reward constructor; Constructs a Rewards object, with coordinates (x,y) = user entered (width,length) on the board, CellType "reward", and size 24x24 (rectangle).

  • Constructor Details

    • Rewards

      public Rewards​(int width, int length)
      Reward constructor; Constructs a Rewards object, with coordinates (x,y) = user entered (width,length) on the board, CellType "reward", and size 24x24 (rectangle).
      Parameters:
      width - an int value representing the x coordinate of the Rewards object on the board
      length - an int value representing the y coordinate of the Rewards object on the board
      See Also:
      Rectangle

  • Method Details

    • setDiff

      public void setDiff​(java.lang.String adiff)
      Reward object diff setter; Sets this Reward object's "diff" as user entered adiff.
      Parameters:
      adiff - a String value entered by the user; For this game, it could be one of three values: "B" for BonusReward, "M" for MandatoryReward, or "D" for dead.
      See Also:
      BonusReward

    • setValReward

      public void setValReward()
      Reward object value setter; Updates this Reward object's value, such that: if it was a BonusReward it would hold a value of 1, if it was a MandatoryReward it would hold a value of 5, and if it was dead it would hold a value of 0.

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation​(int xVal, int yVal)
      Reward object location setter; Changes existing coordinates of this Reward object to user entered values.
      Overrides:
      setLocation in class java.awt.Rectangle
      Parameters:
      xVal - a int value for the new x coordinate.
      yVal - a int value for the new y coordinate.
      See Also:
      Rectangle

    • getDiff

      public java.lang.String getDiff()
      Reward object diff getter; Returns this Reward object's "diff" value.
      Returns:
      a String value of this Reward object's "diff".

    • getValReward

      public int getValReward()
      Reward object value getter; Returns this Reward object's "value" value.
      Returns:
      a int value of this Reward object's "value".

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects​(java.awt.Rectangle r)
      Checks this current Reward object's coordinates and size to see if it has encountered the Player.
      Overrides:
      intersects in class java.awt.Rectangle
      Parameters:
      r - a Rectangle object; in this game it is the user controlled object.
      Returns:
      a boolean value of whether or not the player has been encountered.

    • generation

      public void generation()
      The method of creating Reward objects. Implemented with random generation, the method selects a random number from the range of 0 to the Board's width/height, then checks if the Tile is occupied. The method repeats until a free Tile is located.
      Parameters:
      gameboard - a Board object in order to calculate the correct range of random numbers.
      enemyList - a List object in order to detect if an enemy exists in said Tile

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Display method that renders the correct colour and opacity for each different Reward. If the Reward is a BonusReward it will be rendered in pink, if the Reward is a MandatoryReward, it will be rendered in blue, if the Reward is dead it will be redered transparent.
      Parameters:
      g - Graphics object that allows for coloring of object.
      See Also:
      Graphics
